name: Holiday Inn Express Ocean City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This will be a pool-biased review. I am a pool person so I chose this hotel for the hot tub and pool first then considered the room. The room we had overlooked the bay and smack over the Winterfest lights so if that is your thing this is the perfect hotel at that time. Our room was smallish but neat and clean and good for two of us. The front desk was fine, we are priority members and stayed on points, we were not offered water or gift bags or anything like that which was fine by us because that may help in keeping the prices as low as they are at this time of the year. Also the only toiletries in the room is shampoo and conditioner but the note said you can have other necessities on demand, I just wanted lotion, this too was fine, I loved the price if we were paying. There is a really nice refrigerator which was really cold if set all the way up it semi froze our water etc., microwave nice too. Now to the best part of this hotel: The Pool!!! It was steamy in a rather cold room....no problem because you just want to get in the water and stay there it was in the high eighties, no kidding, I had it all to myself both days as this is the slow season. The hot tub is a corner part of the pool and was nice and hot, little jet issues but no worries it serves its purpose. I really didn't even need the tub becasue the pool was balmy and no shivering getting back in the pool from the hot tub. Ok so the place is not spectacularly 5 star but is in good repair and very clean. The area is home to numerous seafood restaurants many of which were closed for the winter but the Crabcake factory is just two blocks away open year round and had amazing food and fries and REALLY strong drinks. There is a Denny's not too far away for breakfast...oh that is if you sleep past 9:30 for the free breakfast.We looked at the 6600 Holiday inn and the 1701 also on this strip and further down the strip near the end and they looked really nice from the outside and directly on the water but thanks to the reviewers here who said they were dated we went with this one and had a good time. We did have trouble when they changed the wi-fi password and didn't give us the correct info we had to do some digging, but that was minor. All in all if you like peace and quiet and lazing around in a nice hot pool while the cold wind whips outside and you can see the five (now brown) palm trees waving around outside while you warm up your bones... I say go and relax here. Good value in the off season and a nice getaway.
reviews.title: Ahhhhhhh-ma-zing Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here several times this year....the last 3 days in a 2 week period. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The last 3 stays we were given rooms that faced the Winter Fest lights...what a pure joy. Hotel rooms are always clean, beds are comfortable and no annoying air freshner smells. Internet connection is good and tv selection is good. Nice indoor pool and hot tub. Great location, free parking, good value and plenty of restaurants in the area. Breakfast is plentiful. We will definitely stay here again when we are in the area. Consistently great experience.
reviews.title: Consistently Great Experience

reviews.text: Stayed at HIX over Thanksgiving weekend. Front desk personnel very helpful and friendly. Had a suite; lots of room! Great location close to Wawa and movie theaters. Loved being so close to the Winterfest of Lights. Will stay here again next year!
reviews.title: Best stay in years!

reviews.text: I stayed there over a holiday while visiting some friends. Great location. Super price and very friendly. Would definitely eat in the restaurant again even if I wasn't staying there. Free parking was a real treat. Love the city.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have always chosen this Holiday Inn Express and have never been disappointed. Courtious and helpful staff. It is located on the bay side of main street, but short walk to the beach. The breakfast meal is a winner, unless you want a formal breakfast. The room was clean. There was a minor problem with the tub drain, but was tolerable. I think they have a smokers section, so smoke does not spew into other area. We'll likely stay here again. Oh, the community park located behind the inn is great for running, biking, or walking. Sit on the benches, watch the ducks, or the crabbers along the extended walking deck to the bay area. (My wife and I did not like the italian restruant located behind the Inn), but this was several years ago...cups, utensels, found its way in the artificial greenery and left there, next to the tables. Total turn off while eating wondering what the kitchen looks like or whether food is handled the same. (Holiday Inn says not affiliated with restruant)
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: I spent 4 weekday-nights here. It is a later-generation hotel, with fresh decor and very clean in room, hallway, and lobby/breakfast area. Located on the Bay side of the Coastal Highway on the northern fringe of Ocean City in an area where there are mostly private condos, upscale properties and only a few other hotels;it is several miles from the boardwalk (an asset if you prefer a quieter area) but it's on the "beach bus" route if you want to make a trip downtown. You have to cross the highway to reach the beach but the intersection has a traffic light and working crosswalk buttons. Just behind the hotel is the very nice Northside Park. There are sit-down restaurants (seafood, Italian, steak) and cheap eats (subs, wings, pizza) all within a block on the same side of the highway as the hotel, plus a dollar store, groceries, etc.
reviews.title: Clean, fresh, but not fancy, great quiet location

reviews.text: The room was very clean including corners, linens, and bathroom. The bath was a modern one-piece type (no grout to get icky) with a safety-handhold bar, and it was sparkling clean except for a bit of hard water build-up underneath the whirlpool jets. Room a comfortable size, nice flat screen TV and all appliances (hairdryer, fridge, microwave) clean and in working order. Bed comfortable with a variety of pillow "firmnesses" but I always bring my own for my neck problems. No sign of vermin.They did a good job of cleaning up the inevitable tracked-in sand with one exception: the elevator carpeting needed attention. The room was quiet and so were the guests when I was there. It is family friendly.
reviews.title: Right across the street from the beach

reviews.text: I spent my time at the beach, but the outdoor pool looked nice; staff kept it cleared of sand. Service was friendly. The complimentary breakfast had enough variety so that you could try different things on different mornings. It included cereals, yogurts, muffins/pastries/bagels/toast, scrambled eggs, meat (sausage patties or bacon on different days), biscuits and sausage gravy (a Southern dish), and a pancake-making machine (the pancakes are so-so but fun to make.) Plus surprisingly decent coffee/decaf and the usual breakfast juices. As noted by other reviewers it is best to get to the breakfast early (before 8:30) to avoid the rush.
reviews.title: a hotel I trust
Great hotel free breakfast
reviews.text: Not a cheap hotel but probably worth what you pay. Call hotel direct and compare price to any online service quotes you get.

I always check around the bed and matress because I'm paranoid about bed bugs and found a lot of hair behind the bed, I guess it's because the bedskirts don't get changed. The sheets on the bed where clean and th room was nice. It is about a 10-15 min drive from the boardwalk. The beach is a short walk across the street. Great breakfast included.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Very clean, friendly staff, quiet.

reviews.text: My family of 4 adults stayed at this hotel during labor day weekend. It was pretty much the last available room in the ocean city vicinity that weekend. Thank goodness we found this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Stay

reviews.text: Hotel: We stayed in a suite (2 queen beds, a sofa bed). The room was clean and spacious enough for all of us to not feel overcrowded. The staff was great and extremely helpful and pleasant. The pool was nice. Indoor pool was a little small (but good to have) and the outdoor pool was great. Breakfast buffet was awesome, the only thing about it is that the line gets very long. (Get there early!)
reviews.title: Another terrific stay!
if location doesn't matter too much, go for it!
reviews.text: Surrounding Location: There is a park area behind the hotel which has a pier for fishing and a great park for children. There was also some baseball going on in the two fields they have. A path about a mile or so around the park is available for running or biking which was a plus. There are great restaurants in the area and convenient stores for snacks and such. The beach is across the street which is great. Quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk. Speaking of the boardwalk the bus stops right in front of the hotel to go to the boardwalk ($1 each way or $3 all day pass). However, the ride is about 45 mins to an hr long on the bus with all the stops. But it beats parking if you can't find cheap/free parking. Casino is about 10-15 mins away driving.
Overall it was a great time with many benefits even though it is not right on the boardwalk. No complaints, will definitely return.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the money!

reviews.text: I have repeatedly stayed at this hotel. The beds are comfy (pillows have a little to be desired), room was very clean, breakfast was delicious and bountiful and the front desk folks were terrific! The indoor pool is a bit small but the outside pool is large and the pool area very nice, Excellent beach access right across the road. Close to lots of restaurants and the bus stops right in front and is extremely inexpensive to travel anywhere in the town. I was very very pleased and will be back again!
reviews.title: I dont recommend this hotel

reviews.text: We were in Salisbury for a softball tournament, and we got screwed out of our rate at the HIE in Delmar. We got one room at HIE on 126th street, and a condo nearby for chaperones and girls. When I told the desk person manager how we got a pre-pay rate at the Delmar location of $164 per night for 5 rooms, but they didn't charge our card and changed the rate substantially the day of arrival, he did his best to meet the rate we had in Delmar (came within $7). We had a view of the pool and bay. MUCH better than we would've had in Delmar.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great pool

reviews.text: The breakfast was decent, the service folks in the breakfast area and desk were all extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. They have an indoor and outdoor pool that were quite nice. I'd do this again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: good location and comfortable

reviews.text: easy access to beach. Only one block away to the beach and I like the location because it is 7-8miles away from the noisy boardwalk. I know some people would not like it, though....
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I stayed in suite with two double bed and it is quite spacious, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Ocean City!

reviews.text: However, there was no balcony to hang the wet bathing suite and breakfast area was quite crowded, as others mentioned.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

aka: Holiday Inn Express Ocean City Hotel
description: The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is located on 126th street in North Ocean City. The hotel has 122 rooms with 66 suites, some of which have whirlpool tubs. We are only a block and a half from the beautiful beaches that Ocean City has to offer. We are also conveniently located in front of Northside Park Sports Complex that host s lacrosse, soccer, basketball and softball tournaments. The hotel is just a short drive away from the world famous Boardwalk as well as some of the finest restaurants in Ocean City. If you want to play a round while you are here, some of the best golf courses in the area are within a fifteen-minute drive. Our guest room amenities include free wireless high-speed Internet access, refrigerator, microwave, iron and ironing board, coffee maker and a hairdryer. For your convenience a guest laundry is also available. You will enjoy starting your day with our complimentary Express Start breakfast served daily from 6:30am until 9:30 am. The tropical atmosphere of our outdoor pool and sundeck (open in our summer months) will make you so relaxed you will not want your vacation to come to an end. We also have an indoor pool with whirlpool that is open year round. Located between the beach and the bay, Holiday Inn Express is the place to stay.
